page.title: 06A Scunthorpe Special School
page.content: { St. Luke's Special School}caters for physically and mentally handicapped children from the ages of 3 to 16 years. The children from 3 to 5 years are looked after in the{nursery {unit.}At first they attend 2 or 3 days a week when things like washing themselves are taught. At 5 they are split into{Middle school}and {handicapped unit.}The{Middle and Upper {schools}are run on an ordinary basis with special emphasis on activity lessons. Upper school children can do the 3r's. Most have special difficulties. At lunchtime extra staff are required as the children are never left unattended. All are brought to school in{specially adapted transport with one attendant per child. Trips are held during summer term, usually to go swimming and to parks. A {physiotherapist}comes in regularly.
